channel.title: My newest build :D
channel.description: Motherboard: MSI 880GM-E41 CPU: AMD Phenom II Multi Core x4 RAM: 16 GB G Skill (Only Running 3328 MB Ram) (Anyone know how to make it run the whole 16 GB?) OS: Win XP SP3 HDD: 1.120 TB

item.title: My newest build :D
item.dc:creator: @mormonman mormonman
item.description:
@mormonman wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:49, topic:433046”][quote author=eczema3 link=topic=535766.msg3982031#msg3982031 date=1335390211]

[quote author=Pwnd link=topic=535766.msg3981985#msg3981985 date=1335387382]

[quote author=eczema3 link=topic=535766.msg3918047#msg3918047 date=1329415291]

You’re going to bottleneck with your cpu.
[/quote]Not if he’s going to game. CPU means jack shit in modern games, you could run a cheap dual core amd vs a 2600k, and the fps difference would be like 1 or 2 at worst in 99% of modern games.

That’s actually very wrong. I had a GTX460 with some shitty AMD dual core thing, wouldn’t even get a steady 125fps on call of duty 4, upgraded my cpu and now I get 250 constant.
[/quote]OH NO, CANT EVEN GET A STEADY 125FPS OH MAN I WISH MY BRAIN WAS ABLE TO INTERPRET THAT

It’s not about what your brain can interpret, it’s the gameplay advantages you get at the different FPS levels.

http://wiki.modsrepository.com/index.php/Call_of_Duty_:_A_Study_on_FPS
[/quote]So the consensus is that the developers are incompetent. We already knew that.[/quote]

I think its a conspiracy to get gamers to buy more expensive components.

Read full topic

item.title: My newest build :D
item.dc:creator: @sin21 sin2^
item.description:
@sin21 wrote:

[quote=“tL, post:41, topic:433046”]Well it depends entirely what you are doing with those processors.

It’s like taking an a new porsche 911, driving it in a straight line at 60MPH next to an older slower porsche 911 at the same speed and then concluding “Oh, so the new car must not be any better”.

Because you are only testing it against one limited situation. You would be ignoring the fact the newer car is more efficient, it can squeeze more power out of the same sized engine, it can manage it’s power better, it is more fuel efficient, it can accelerate quicker , handles better and has a faster top speed.

There are parallels with that analogy directly with processors. Energy efficiency, raw computing performance, the way it manages the power available to it, etc.[/quote]
Fine, you win.

Read full topic

item.title: My newest build :D
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Well it depends entirely what you are doing with those processors.

It’s like taking an a new porsche 911, driving it in a straight line at 60MPH next to an older slower porsche 911 at the same speed and then concluding “Oh, so the new car must not be any better”.

Because you are only testing it against one limited situation. You would be ignoring the fact the newer car is more efficient, it can squeeze more power out of the same sized engine, it can manage it’s power better, it is more fuel efficient, it can accelerate quicker , handles better and has a faster top speed.

There are parallels with that analogy directly with processors. Energy efficiency, raw computing performance, the way it manages the power available to it, etc.

Read full topic

item.title: My newest build :D
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

before:
Specification
Core Speed - 3200 MHz
Voltages - 0.825-1.40V
Max Temps © - 74
Wattage - 65 W
Virtualization - Yes
L1 Cache Size (KB) - 128
L1 Cache Count - 2
L2 Cache Size (KB) - 1024
L2 Cache Count - 2
CMOS 45nm SOI
Socket AM3

after:
Processor AMD Athlon II X4 (640) 3.0GHz 4 x 128KB (L1 Cache) 4 x 512KB (L2 Cache)
Socket Socket AM3
Architecture 32/64-bit
Technology 45nm
Number of Cores 4

So difference in the after is double the L1 cache, lower clock speed, and 4 cores instead of 2. What’s the FSB speed?

Read full topic

item.title: My newest build :D
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

[quote=“t4, post:29, topic:433046”][quote author=eczema3 link=topic=535766.msg3918047#msg3918047 date=1329415291]

You’re going to bottleneck with your cpu.
[/quote]Not if he’s going to game. CPU means jack shit in modern games, you could run a cheap dual core amd vs a 2600k, and the fps difference would be like 1 or 2 at worst in 99% of modern games.

That’s actually very wrong. I had a GTX460 with some shitty AMD dual core thing, wouldn’t even get a steady 125fps on call of duty 4, upgraded my cpu and now I get 250 constant.

please post the model of your processor before and after.[/quote]
I don’t remember what it was I had at first, but something like this: http://www.ebuyer.com/235423-amd-athlon-ii-x2-260-3-2-ghz-socket-am3-2mb-cache-retail-adx260ocgmbox
To this: http://www.google.co.uk/products/catalog?hl=en&cp=20&gs_id=8&xhr=t&q=amd+athlon+ii+x4+640&safe=off&gs_upl=&bav=on.2,or.r_gc.r_pw.r_cp.r_qf.,cf.osb&biw=1920&bih=955&ion=1&um=1&ie=UTF-8&tbm=shop&cid=14060751168628792063&sa=X&ei=-YU-T_HbJNGn8gOx0dy2CA&sqi=2&ved=0CDUQ8wIwAA

item.title: My newest build :D
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Greeny, post:28, topic:433046”]I’d agree CoD4 is the best of the Modern Warfare franchise but really, that’s not hard to accomplish because from what I’ve seen the recent instalments are god awful. CoD4 was a fun game to play with friends and nothing more.

I think CoD2 was the best Call of Duty though. Totally subjective, but it doesn’t get away from the fact it’s moved into being a casual console players game (and that demise began, arguably, at CoD4 :p).

Anyway to not rattle too far off topic here, I dont think spending extra money on a better CPU would have made any difference to OP. I’m pretty sure he doesn’t care about strafing bugs in CoD! This is especially true considering there is no mention of a GPU in his post.[/quote]I am in full agreement with Greeny regarding CoD2 being the best in the series. It was the pinnacle before all the macho fantasy arcade shit started.

Read full topic

item.title: My newest build :D
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

I’d agree CoD4 is the best of the Modern Warfare franchise but really, that’s not hard to accomplish because from what I’ve seen the recent instalments are god awful. CoD4 was a fun game to play with friends and nothing more.

I think CoD2 was the best Call of Duty though. Totally subjective, but it doesn’t get away from the fact it’s moved into being a casual console players game (and that demise began, arguably, at CoD4 :p).

Anyway to not rattle too far off topic here, I dont think spending extra money on a better CPU would have made any difference to OP. I’m pretty sure he doesn’t care about strafing bugs in CoD! This is especially true considering there is no mention of a GPU in his post.

Read full topic
